title: Accidentally hit delete all on Inbox - now TB is fetching mail from server and filling trash folder, wh
creator: ps21
content: I was switching from Outlook to Thunderbird and not being familiar with the tab layout made a dumb mistake, I thought I was deleting a tab with filtered spam but instead I selected all in my unified inbox and hit send to trash. It dumped about 4000 into trash that were not important but when that was empty it started pulling older email off the IMAP servers and filling the trash up again. I have about 28000 emails (I assume that makes me a hoarder) about 200 of which need to be kept. I took Thunderbird offline, deleted the Windows app, redownloaded and as soon as I added the accounts back in it started deleting again. Is there anyway to stop the delete all inbox transfer or do I just need to go back to Outlook or another email client?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 26_2_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) CriOS/144.0.7559.95 Mobile/15E148 Safari/604.1;os:Win 11

title: I cant send email
creator: mm47
content:
I get this message when I try to send out emails:

Det gick inte att skicka meddelandet. Ett fel uppstod när e-post skulle skickas. Servern svarade: [M5] Your credentials have been compromised. Please change your password or contact support (2fe59c46-0669-11f1-a827-e90f2b8e16ca). Kontrollera att din e-postadress är korrekt i dina kontoinställningar och försök igen

I changed password, and it changed to this:

[R9] Your credentials have been compromised. Clean your devices from malware, change your password or contact support (4beaa535-066d-11f1-a6bf-f7376af24660).

Through my e-mail provide one.com, its working as usual. My other emails works on Thunderbird as well.

I still receive email to Thunderbird email.

title: Veel ongewenste berichten ontvangen.
creator: johansikkema
content:
Goede morgen, Vanaf 20 januari 2026 ontvang ik ongewenste meldingen, bijvoorbeeld "MIJN ZIGGO, laatste waarschuwing, uw account wordt gedeactiveerd". Inmiddels zijn het 38 meldingen. Thunderbird waarschuwt wel: Denkt dat dit bericht ongewenst is. Daarboven staan een aantal mogelijkheden: Beantwoorden, Doorsturen, Archiveren, Ongewenst, Verwijderen en Meer. Dan is het vreemd, dat "Ongewenst" als enige niet donker is, zodat ik deze mogelijkheid niet aan kan klikken. Dat los ik op door "Verplaatsen" te kiezen en op te slaan in de map "Ongewenst". Daardoor weet ik nu dat het er inmiddels 38 meldingen zijn. Op 27 januari 7x.

Het zijn steeds verschillende afzenders, twee voorbeelden: "dredx@sccheats.co.uk" en "tyrakel.de". Uiteraard klik ik niet verder aan! Hebben jullie een oplossing voor mij?

Met vriendelijke groet, Johan Sikkema

privacygevoelige gegevens verwijderd
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0

title: Can I use TB to store all old email which I want to delete from server?
creator: xiiip11
content:
Hi all. My mail account reached 50 GB (it's too much) and this is what I plan to do:

1) Download all emails to TB 2) Remove emails older then 1 year from server (for now I don't know how to do that) 3) Keep all emails in TB and use it as my local database - if I'm looking for some old mails then I will go to TB

Important information - daily I don't use TB. I log to my mail via web gui.

The question is - what TB will do when it connects to server and notices that older emails are deleted. Will TB also delete them locally? It's not what I want - my goal is to keep old emails locally. Should I disconnect TB from server after downloading all email by changing credentials?

Please tell me what you think about that plan. Do you see better way to store old emails and keep mailbox slim on the server? I want to fit in 2-5 GB.

By the way do you have idea how to delete mails older then 1 year from server? I have shell access.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0;os:Win10

title: Thunderbird Account
creator: pasqualester
content:
Hello, I have two microsoft email addresses linked to Thunderbird, one @hotmail.com and one @outlook.com. I have been using Thunderbird with them both fine for some time. Recently, the outlook.com account has stopped sending emails via Thunderbird. As far as I can tell, this was out of nowhere, and I hadn't changed any settings. It still receives emails.

Both accounts use the same SMTP information, and the hotmail.com continues to work with those details.

I have tried changing the settings and even deleting and readding the account but it hasn't fixed it. I have also checked the outlook account is still IMAP and POP enabled and it is.

When I do try and send an email, I am told: "Login to server smtp.office365.com with username bufflehead_mike@outlook.com failed. with options to Retry, Enter New Password (which loads a new window briefly but then disappears) and Cancel."

When I cancel, I get this message: "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com timed out. Try again."

My server settings, on both accounts, are: smtp.office365.com Port 587 STARTTLS OAuth2 And the user name matches the email.

Does anyone know what I might be doing wrong, and how I could fix it? Thank you!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 11

title: Bug or Feature?: IMAP-Sync of Sent Folder
creator: asbach2
content:
A few weeks ago, I had to re-add my email account in Thunderbird and took the opportunity to switch from POP3 to IMAP. I am generally familiar with the synchronization behavior associated with IMAP. However, I did not pay close attention to the Sent folder at the time, and I have now noticed that there are almost no sent emails stored on my local computer. When I checked with my email provider (freemail.web.de), I discovered that the retention period for sent emails is limited to 30 days. Apparently, the sent emails (in the “Sent” folder) are synchronized with the server and are therefore deleted from my local system as well once they are removed on the server.

​I have now increased the retention period on the server, but I would still like to clarify the following points:

  • Is the synchronization of the Sent folder in fact intended to mirror the server folder (i.e. including the deletion of emails)?
  • If so, is it possible to configure the synchronization to be one‑way only (i.e. that new emails from the server are added locally, but emails that are no longer present on the server are not deleted from the local Sent folder)?


-- Thunderbird 115.18.0 (32-bit) on Windows
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0
